en_instruction: Describe the structure of a protein in layman terms.
en_output: A protein is made up of a chain of building blocks called amino acids, which are connected together like links in a chain. The structure of proteins is determined by how the amino acids are linked together, forming the distinctive shape of the protein and allowing it to interact with other proteins and perform its function.
zh_instruction: 用通俗的术语描述蛋白质的结构。
zh_output: 蛋白质由称为氨基酸的构建块链组成，它们像链中的链接一样连接在一起。蛋白质的结构取决于氨基酸如何连接在一起，形成蛋白质的独特形状，并允许它与其他蛋白质相互作用并执行其功能。

en_instruction: Analyze how urbanization has changed culture in a city you are familiar with.
en_output: Urbanization has had a profound effect on the culture of my city, Seattle. It has led to the emergence of diverse neighborhoods that reflect the many facets of life in the city. For example, the increasing number of tech companies in the city has resulted in the growth of the South Lake Union district, a hub of activity with trendy restaurants, bars, shops, and high-rises. This area has become a destination for both workers and leisure seekers, with its multitude of attractions. In contrast, there are still many areas of the city that have managed to retain their unique character. Neighborhoods like Ballard and Fremont are home to a mix of old-world charm and modern-day amenities, offering locals and visitors alike a vibrant and diverse cityscape. The constant influx of new people has also resulted in a richly varied cultural scene. From street art to cozy cafés, there is something for every taste in Seattle. The evolution of the city reflects its roots in diverse traditions and continues to attract visitors from all over the world with its vibrant culture and cuisine. As the city continues to grow, it is likely that its culture will evolve in new and exciting ways.
zh_instruction: 分析城市化如何改变您熟悉的城市的文化。
zh_output: 城市化对我的城市西雅图的文化产生了深远的影响。它导致了多元化社区的出现，反映了城市生活的方方面面。例如，该市科技公司数量的增加导致了南湖联合区的发展，这是一个拥有时尚餐厅、酒吧、商店和高层建筑的活动中心。该地区已成为工人和休闲寻求者的目的地，拥有众多景点。相比之下，该市仍有许多地区设法保留了其独特的特色。巴拉德和弗里蒙特等社区融合了旧世界的魅力和现代设施，为当地人和游客提供了充满活力和多样化的城市景观。新人的不断涌入也导致了丰富多样的文化场景。从街头艺术到舒适的咖啡馆，西雅图有适合各种口味的东西。这座城市的演变反映了其多元文化的根源，并以其充满活力的文化和美食继续吸引着来自世界各地的游客。随着城市的不断发展，其文化很可能会以令人兴奋的方式发展。

en_instruction: Create a story for a children's book about a crocodile.
en_output:
Once upon a time, in a swampy river far away, lived a happy-go-lucky croc by the name of Crocky. He was always full of joy and had a wide smile on his face. He loved swimming in the swamps, basking in the sun, and napping on the riverbank. But, Crocky's biggest pleasure was visiting with his friends the birds.

Each day, Crocky would paddle up to his favorite spot by the bird-bath and sit and chat with the birds all afternoon. The birds loved Crocky so much, they often brought him gifts. One day, they brought him a shiny gem, and he was so excited, he nearly lost it when a giant fish nearly gobbled it up! 

The birds laughed and chirped, telling Crocky not to worry, they would find him many more gems. And sure enough, the birds did find Crocky many more gems, and each day, he grew happier and happier with his bird friends. 

But one day, Crocky noticed his bird friends were not around the bird-bath when he arrived. He asked the other animals in the area if they had seen his friends, but no one had. Then one of the frogs in the swamp suggested that Crocky should come to the center of the swamp to find his friends. 

Crocky was hesitant, for he had never been to the center of the swamp before. But eventually, he decided to give it a try and paddled off in the direction of the center of the swamp. After a while, he saw a large gathering of birds at the edge of the river, and he knew that his bird friends must be there. 

When Crocky paddled closer, he saw that the birds were all singing, swaying, and dancing around something in the middle of the river. As he got closer, he saw it was a giant golden egg! He couldn't believe his eyes! 

Turns out, the birds had brought Crocky to a special celebration. They were celebrating the hatching of the baby crocodile that was inside the giant golden egg! Crocky was so happy and he thanked the birds for bringing him and his new baby crocodile friend to the celebration. 

Since then, Crocky and his baby crocodile friend have enjoyed swimming, playing and basking in the sun together in the swampy river and are always visited by their bird friends.

The End.
zh_instruction: 为一本关于鳄鱼的儿童读物创建一个故事。
zh_output:
从前，在遥远的一条沼泽河里，住着一条名叫克洛基的快乐幸运鳄鱼。他总是充满喜悦，脸上挂着灿烂的笑容。他喜欢在沼泽里游泳，晒太阳，在河岸上打盹。但是，克洛基最大的乐趣是和他的朋友一起参观鸟类。

每天，克洛基都会划到鸟浴池旁他最喜欢的地方，整个下午都坐下来和鸟儿聊天。鸟儿们非常喜欢克洛基，他们经常给他带来礼物。有一天，他们给他带来了一颗闪亮的宝石，他非常兴奋，当一条大鱼差点把它吞噬时，他差点把它弄丢了！

鸟儿们笑着叽叽喳喳，告诉克洛基不要担心，他们会给他找到更多的宝石。果然，鸟儿们确实找到了更多的宝石，而且每天，他和他的鸟朋友在一起越来越快乐。

但有一天，克洛基注意到当他到达时，他的鸟朋友不在鸟浴周围。他问该地区的其他动物是否见过他的朋友，但没有人见过。然后沼泽中的一只青蛙建议克洛基应该到沼泽中心去找他的朋友。

克洛基犹豫了，因为他以前从未去过沼泽的中心。但最终，他决定试一试，朝着沼泽中心的方向划去。过了一会儿，他看到河边有一大群鸟，他知道他的鸟朋友一定在那里。

当克洛基划近时，他看到鸟儿都在河中央唱歌、摇摆、跳舞。当他走近时，他看到那是一个巨大的金蛋！他简直不敢相信自己的眼睛！

原来，这些鸟把克洛基带到了一个特别的庆祝活动中。他们正在庆祝巨型金蛋内的小鳄鱼孵化！克洛基非常高兴，他感谢鸟儿们带他和他的新鳄鱼宝宝朋友参加庆祝活动。

从那以后，克洛基和他的小鳄鱼朋友喜欢在沼泽河里游泳、玩耍和晒太阳，他们的鸟类朋友总是光顾他们。

结束。

en_instruction: Generate an opening sentence for a podcast about mental health.
en_output: Welcome to the Mental Health Matters podcast, where we explore the intersection between mental wellbeing and our everyday lives. This week, we’ll look at how our mindsets, thoughts, and feelings can affect how we interact with the world around us. Join us as we dive into the minds of experts, delve into our own selves, and seek to understand how we can use our own mental health to improve our overall quality of life.
zh_instruction: 为有关心理健康的播客生成一个开场白。
zh_output: 欢迎来到心理健康问题播客，我们将在这里探索心理健康与日常生活之间的交集。本周，我们将看看我们的心态、思想和感受如何影响我们与周围世界的互动方式。加入我们，深入了解专家的思想，深入研究我们自己的自我，并寻求了解如何利用自己的心理健康来提高我们的整体生活质量。

en_instruction: Generate an interesting way to reform laws concerning tax evasion.
en_output: To reform laws concerning tax evasion, government agencies should consider instituting an increased monetary penalty for offenders as well as a public shaming system. This system could include publicizing the names and photos of convicted tax evaders, or even their professional or family affiliations. In addition, government agencies should consider implementing methods of tracking self-employed individuals and businesses more closely, such as registering vehicles used for business purposes and requiring registration of those vehicles with tax authorities. Finally, there should be a greater emphasis on educating citizens about the penalties and implications associated with tax evasion. By improving awareness of the consequences of tax evasion, citizens will be more likely to comply with legal regulations and avoid the penalties that accompany breaking the law.
zh_instruction: 产生一种有趣的方法来改革有关逃税的法律。
zh_output: 为了改革有关逃税的法律，政府机构应考虑对违法者实施加重的罚款以及公开羞辱制度。该系统可能包括公布被定罪的逃税者的姓名和照片，甚至他们的职业或家庭关系。此外，政府机构应考虑实施更密切地跟踪自营职业个人和企业的方法，例如登记用于商业目的的车辆，并要求向税务机关登记这些车辆。最后，应更加重视教育公民了解与逃税有关的处罚和影响。通过提高对逃税后果的认识，公民将更有可能遵守法律法规并避免伴随违法而来的处罚。

en_instruction: Design a well-crafted question that can assess the performance of a GPT model.
en_output: What is the maximum number of words the GPT model can generate while still maintaining at least 75% accuracy on factual information?
zh_instruction: 设计一个精心设计的问题，可以评估 GPT 模型的性能。
zh_output: GPT 模型在保持对事实信息至少 75% 的准确率的同时，可以生成的最大字数是多少？
